channel.title: MineCraft diary
channel.description:
i have recently found a series of text connected to each other somehow, it's a guy who is telling his story to everyone i really recommend reading this (i'm currently doing so)
Graham is mentioned in it too even tho i don't know if it's our Graham.
http://www.pcgamer.com/2010/11/20/the-minecraft-experiment-day-1-chasing-waterfalls/
have fun reading!

item.title: MineCraft diary
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:21, topic:385329”]#Minecraftteenrape

I have not read the journal of a creeper or whatever, but the title sounds interesting.[/quote]
I bet I can read it first
add me on msn GodzChaosX@hotmail.com

Read full topic

item.title: MineCraft diary
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:19, topic:385329”][quote author=riku9182 link=topic=481083.msg3524536#msg3524536 date=1299697757]

There’s an app on Itunes called “MineCraft Pro”.

And it has some neat stuff in it, such as recipe guides, blue print’s, and awesome stories. (I mean stories as in take you a day to read not 2 hour’s :P)

Point is: I really enjoyed the stories on there

I bought it, and the stories really are amazing. Including “Mindcraft”.

Read that one called “100 day’s to mine” or something like that.
It was my favorite.

Was that the one with the boy & girl who build a kingdom, and the douchebag who dies 4 times?

Yes sir >.>

Oh God, that one was amazing.

Is it wierd I got a boner when a 15 yr old got raped?

I’m not the only one?
No longer alone

We’re good then
We should start a
“Do you get a boner when a 15yr. old get’s raped?” Club
I bet we would get alot of members =P
[/quote]
inb4facebookgroups
inb5googlegroups[/quote]
Don’t forget twitter

Read full topic

item.title: MineCraft diary
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

CoonHunter:

Hmm, interesting, die, delete world, and start over. I actually might do this, sounds challenging.

I do this already. It’s called ragequit

Read full topic

item.title: MineCraft diary
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:10, topic:385329”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=481083.msg3523084#msg3523084 date=1299558421]

Hmm, interesting, die, delete world, and start over. I actually might do this, sounds challenging.

Except some smart people discovered the reason chests were there - they found out chests weren’t only decoration, after all!
[/quote]
I don’t believe you understand what the point of that is. The point of ‘Die, and start over’ is not because of the loss of any items, its the point to play as if it was more real. When you die irl though, you don’t ‘start over’. It would make you treat every bit of food and material more carefully, and more attention to detail. Try starting a new SSP world, and every time you die, delete the world, and start a new one.[/quote]
Ohh alright then.

Read full topic

item.title: MineCraft diary
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:9, topic:385329”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=481083.msg3523071#msg3523071 date=1299557165]
Hmm, interesting, die, delete world, and start over. I actually might do this, sounds challenging.
[/quote]
Except some smart people discovered the reason chests were there - they found out chests weren’t only decoration, after all![/quote]
I don’t believe you understand what the point of that is. The point of ‘Die, and start over’ is not because of the loss of any items, its the point to play as if it was more real. When you die irl though, you don’t ‘start over’. It would make you treat every bit of food and material more carefully, and more attention to detail. Try starting a new SSP world, and every time you die, delete the world, and start a new one.

Read full topic
